questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the six types of time in fiction discussed in the module?
choices: Classic Time
Long Time
Switchback Time
Circular Time
questions.answer: Circular Time

questions.question: What is the primary focus of 'Slowed Time' in fiction?
choices: Covering long periods of history
Zooming in on short periods to create tension or introspection
Moving back and forth between different time periods
Exploring magical elements of time
questions.answer: Zooming in on short periods to create tension or introspection

questions.question: In the context of historical fiction, what does 'Time as Subject' refer to?
choices: Using time travel as a plot device
Focusing on clock-making in the story
Exploring philosophical questions about the nature of time
Writing about the history of timekeeping
questions.answer: Exploring philosophical questions about the nature of time

questions.question: What is a key consideration when using real historical figures in fiction?
choices: Always portraying them positively
Avoiding mentioning them by name
Navigating legal and ethical considerations
Only using them as main characters
questions.answer: Navigating legal and ethical considerations

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a technique for describing settings?
choices: Sensory details
Mood and atmosphere
Symbolism in setting
Extensive historical timelines
questions.answer: Extensive historical timelines

questions.question: What is the recommended approach for integrating historical details into a story?
choices: Including lengthy explanations of historical events
Avoiding all historical references to focus on characters
Integrating details naturally within the narrative
Using footnotes for all historical information
questions.answer: Integrating details naturally within the narrative

questions.question: Which of the following is emphasized as important when researching for historical fiction?
choices: Focusing solely on major historical events
Relying exclusively on secondary sources
Studying daily life details and social norms
Avoiding primary sources to maintain creativity
questions.answer: Studying daily life details and social norms

questions.question: What is the recommended approach to language in historical fiction?
choices: Using entirely modern language for accessibility
Employing only archaic language for authenticity
Balancing historical accuracy with readability
Avoiding dialogue altogether
questions.answer: Balancing historical accuracy with readability

questions.question: What is the purpose of using 'Switchback Time' in fiction?
choices: To confuse the reader
To add depth to characters and create suspense
To avoid writing about the present
To make the story longer
questions.answer: To add depth to characters and create suspense

questions.question: In the example outline for a World War I story, what moral dilemma does the main character face?
choices: Whether to desert the army
Which trench to return to after helping an enemy soldier
Whether to reveal a friend's cowardice
How to escape the war entirely
questions.answer: Which trench to return to after helping an enemy soldier

questions.question: What is the main conflict in the Renaissance-era story outline?
choices: A love triangle between artists
Sabotage by a rival apprentice
A dispute over payment for artwork
The challenge of creating a masterpiece
questions.answer: Sabotage by a rival apprentice

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a theme in the Renaissance story outline?
choices: The struggle between talent and social status
The importance of integrity in art and life
The power of perseverance and dedication
The conflict between science and religion
questions.answer: The conflict between science and religion

questions.question: What is emphasized as crucial when addressing sensitive historical topics in fiction?
choices: Avoiding them entirely
Only presenting modern perspectives
Balancing historical accuracy with sensitivity to modern readers
Focusing solely on positive aspects of history
questions.answer: Balancing historical accuracy with sensitivity to modern readers

questions.question: What is the recommended approach to creating characters in historical fiction?
choices: Making them entirely modern in thought and behavior
Developing characters that fit the time period in speech and worldview
Avoiding character development to focus on historical events
Only using real historical figures as characters
questions.answer: Developing characters that fit the time period in speech and worldview

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Historical Writers Association?
choices: To publish historical fiction
To fund historical research
To help traditionally published authors connect and find opportunities
To organize historical reenactments
questions.answer: To help traditionally published authors connect and find opportunities

questions.question: What is the deadline for submissions to the HWA/DDS Short Story Award 2024?
choices: 1 June
1 July
1 August
1 September
questions.answer: 1 July

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a Crown category for the HWA Crowns 2024?
choices: Debut
Gold
Non-Fiction
Young Adult
questions.answer: Young Adult

questions.question: What was Elizabeth Buchan's first role in the publishing industry?
choices: Fiction editor
Blurb writer
Literary agent
Copyeditor
questions.answer: Blurb writer

questions.question: What is the recommended approach to fact-checking in historical fiction?
choices: Relying solely on personal knowledge
Avoiding fact-checking to maintain creativity
Having work reviewed by historians or experts
Only fact-checking major historical events
questions.answer: Having work reviewed by historians or experts

questions.question: What is the purpose of using beta readers in historical fiction?
choices: To proofread for spelling errors
To ensure historical accuracy
To check if the story is engaging and accessible to modern audiences
To write the historical sections of the novel
questions.answer: To check if the story is engaging and accessible to modern audiences

questions.question: What is emphasized as important when visiting historical sites for research?
choices: Taking as many artifacts as possible
Focusing only on major landmarks
Getting a sense of the physical environment
Avoiding interaction with local experts
questions.answer: Getting a sense of the physical environment

questions.question: What is the recommended approach to handling anachronisms in historical fiction?
choices: Including them freely to appeal to modern readers
Avoiding them entirely, even if it makes the story less accessible
Using them sparingly and only when necessary for the plot
Highlighting them to show contrast between past and present
questions.answer: Using them sparingly and only when necessary for the plot

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'Fabulous Time' in fiction?
choices: To focus on celebrity lifestyles
To explore magical or scientifically speculative elements of time
To write about the fashion industry
To create unrealistic timelines
questions.answer: To explore magical or scientifically speculative elements of time

questions.question: What is emphasized as important when researching historical figures for fiction?
choices: Focusing only on their public personas
Avoiding all controversial aspects of their lives
Thorough research of both public and private lives
Creating entirely fictional backgrounds for them
questions.answer: Thorough research of both public and private lives

questions.question: What is the recommended approach to dialogue in historical fiction?
choices: Using modern slang to appeal to younger readers
Avoiding dialogue altogether to prevent inaccuracies
Using period-specific idioms and speech patterns
Only using direct quotes from historical documents
questions.answer: Using period-specific idioms and speech patterns

questions.question: What is the purpose of exploring universal themes in historical fiction?
choices: To avoid focusing on historical details
To make the story more marketable
To resonate with contemporary readers
To simplify complex historical events
questions.answer: To resonate with contemporary readers

questions.question: What is emphasized as important when balancing historical accuracy and storytelling in fiction?
choices: Always prioritizing accuracy over narrative
Ignoring historical facts to focus on character development
Finding a balance that serves the story while respecting history
Alternating chapters between fiction and non-fiction
questions.answer: Finding a balance that serves the story while respecting history

questions.question: What is the recommended approach to handling sensitive historical topics?
choices: Avoiding them entirely
Only presenting them from a modern perspective
Addressing them authentically while being mindful of modern sensibilities
Exaggerating them for dramatic effect
questions.answer: Addressing them authentically while being mindful of modern sensibilities

questions.question: What is the purpose of using multiple timelines in historical fiction?
choices: To confuse the reader
To pad the word count
To explore connections between different historical periods
To avoid focusing on a single time period
questions.answer: To explore connections between different historical periods

questions.question: What is emphasized as important when creating the atmosphere of a historical setting?
choices: Using only visual descriptions
Focusing solely on major historical events
Incorporating multiple sensory details
Avoiding all references to the time period
questions.answer: Incorporating multiple sensory details
